I 4 0 94 33685BAHREIN NOTICE The following Regulation made by the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf and allowed by His Majesty's Principal Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs is published for general information in accordance with the provisions of Article 72 of the Bahrein Order-in-Council, 1913. King's Regulation under Article 70 (c) of the Bahrein Order-in- Council, 1913 1. The Christian Marriage Regulation, 1922 (King's Regulation No. 2 of 1922), is hereby amended as under; — After Article 1 there shall be inserted the following new Article: — 1 a . In its application to Bahrein, the Indian Christian Marriage Act, 1872, shall be modified as follows: — (a) Add as the third paragraph to Section 38—' or, if neither of the parties dwells or has dwelt within the district of any Marriage Registrar, shall give the like notice to the Marriage Registrar by or before whom the marriage is intended to be solemnised.' (b) Insert between the first and second clauses of the proviso to Section 41—' that, in the case of parties neither of whom dwells, or has dwelt, within the district of any Marriage Registrar, the Marriage Registrar is satisfied that the marriage cannot conveniently be solemnised at the place where either of the parties has dwelt and that the marriage is not clandestine.' No. 1 of 1948 14617 35072t (r) Add to Section 42 (6)—' or, as the case may be, that neither party has had his or her usual place of abode within the district of any Marriage Registrar.' (f/) Add to the fourth paragraph of Section 51 the following proviso— '* provided that, in the case of parties neither of whom dwells, or has dwelt, within the district of any Marriage Registrar, the Marriage Registrar in whose presence the marriage shall be solemnised shall be the Marriage Registrar to whom the notice under Section 88 was given.' 2. This Regulation may be cited as ' The Christian Marriage (Amendment) Regulation, 1948.' Bahrein hn.l-k^ Political Resident, Persian Gulf. 1948. mods.abstract: Notices of King's Regulations made by the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf under Article 70 (C) of the Bahrain Order in Council, 1913(His Majesty's Stationery Office, 1913): The Christian Marriage (Amendment) Regulation 1947, signed and dated 30 July 1947; and The Christian Marriage (Amendment) Regulation, 1948, signed and dated 21 April 1948.
